title: Identify access to technology
description: Without access to the internet it will prove difficult to provide access to as many people as possible.

f6_assessments.q0: Unfortunately the proposal is lack of many details and it is hard to give any rating. Please invest some more time and share more details about the project, how and with whom it would be realised.
f6_assessments.q1: One person experience is provided, however it is unclear how and what would be implemented.
f6_assessments.q2: As written above, more information would be necessary to elaborate the audibility as well.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposal do not address any challenge as its problem statement seem hard to understand ("Without access to the internet it will prove difficult to provide access to as many people as possible.").
The solution provide by the proposal seem to lack content to clearly show how this solution will help grow the cardano community in Africa , what problems it is solving , potential pitfalls, timelines and execution plan.
I strongly disagree.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposal did not make any effort to provide evidence of experience with verifiable links, zero implementation plan and cost breakdown.
This proposal will require a more in-depth implementation plan.
I strongly disagree.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal did not present sufficient information for audit.I strongly disagree.

f6_assessments.q0: Draft proposal. There is not enough information for impact assessment. I would recommend using the Catalyst documentation as a reference for a new proposal, more precisely the document proposal writing guide in the FAQ section on the IdeaScale Catalyst homepage.
f6_assessments.q1: Draft proposal. There is not enough information for feasibility assessment. I would recommend using the Catalyst documentation as a reference for a new proposal, more precisely the document proposal writing guide in the FAQ section on the IdeaScale Catalyst homepage.
f6_assessments.q2: Draft proposal. There is not enough information for auditability assessment. I would recommend using the Catalyst documentation as a reference for a new proposal, more precisely the document proposal writing guide in the FAQ section on the IdeaScale Catalyst homepage.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal is incomplete in scope. There are many GIS tools with open data to analyze the penetration of the internet in Africa. There are few open-source datasets exclusively for Africa. Therefore, creating a new one or analyzing the data with the existing one cannot be considered a viable proposal.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer claims to have worked in GIS mapping in the past. No other details are provided, making it impossible to evaluate his experience and capability to implement the proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal has no clear deliverable, scope, or plan; therefore, it is not auditable in any manner. No rationale for the budget is also provided in the proposal.

f6_assessments.q0: While access to Internet off course is something important, this proposal does not give the impression of providing it.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer does not present a plan or a rationale for the very high budget.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal barely exists, neither do any metrics or any other possibility to Audit it.

f6_assessments.q0: Too brief and not enough information to understand the task and challenge
f6_assessments.q1: Experience and plan noted is brief with no information on planning and defining any resources for the proposal
f6_assessments.q2: The information is insufficient, no planning and no roadmap. Much more development is needed with this project

solution: Use of GIS/Data Analytics to define 1) # of people with access to internet by area (land/Mobile) 2) Extending access to other populations
experience: Worked on GIS mapping in the past.
